qas.question: What studio helped to relaunch and revamp classic marvel teams The Fantastic Four and the Avengers?
What two Marvel veterans founded Image?
How was the setting for the Image versions of Marvel characters different from the official comics?

answers.text: a parallel universe with a history distinct from the mainstream

qas.question: How long did the Image run of Marvel characters last?
What three titles were part of the darker, grimmer Marvel Knights comics?

answers.text: the Inhumans, Black Panther and Daredevil

qas.question: What year did Joe Quesada become editor in chief?
How long did Marvel Knights run for?
What caused Image Comics to discontinue the Marvel crossover?

context: In <b6_0>1996<b6_0/>, Marvel had some of its titles participate in "Heroes Reborn", a crossover that allowed Marvel to relaunch some of its flagship characters such as the Avengers and the Fantastic Four, and outsource them to the studios of two of the former Marvel artists turned <a0_0>Image Comics<a0_0/> founders, <a1_0><b5_0>Jim Lee and Rob Liefeld<b5_0/><a1_0/>. The relaunched titles, which saw the characters transported to <a2_0>a parallel universe with a history distinct from the mainstream<a2_0/> Marvel Universe, were a solid success amidst <b9_0>a generally struggling industry<b9_0/>, but Marvel discontinued the experiment after <a3_0><b8_0>a one-year run<b8_0/><a3_0/> and returned the characters to the Marvel Universe proper. In <b7_0>1998<b7_0/>, the company launched the imprint Marvel Knights, taking place within Marvel continuity; helmed by soon-to-become editor-in-chief Joe Quesada, it featured tough, gritty stories showcasing such characters as <a4_0>the Inhumans, Black Panther and Daredevil<a4_0/>.
